resources.string: How to become a Ui / Ux designer
By choosing a role, you will find it easier to get the part that should have that role

You have a unique chance to test your logic and intuition, and maybe your knowledge! Choose a match and try to guess the outcome. If you can\'t choose a match by yourself, our great random function does it for you!

In this module, students learn the basic concepts of programming, such as variables, operators, conditional statements, and loops. They also practice writing simple programs in programming languages like Python or Java

In this module, students learn about different data structures such as arrays, linked lists, stacks, and queues. They study their basic operations and algorithms, as well as the application of each data structure in programming

In this module, students delve into the study of functions and modules in programming. They learn how to define and use functions, as well as how to organize their code using modules. Students also familiarize themselves with concepts of scope and module importing

In this module, students learn about various types of errors in programming and ways to handle them using exceptions. They learn how to use try-except blocks to handle exceptions and prevent program crashes
In this module, students learn about web technologies and the basics of web application development. They study HTML and CSS markup languages, basic elements of a web page, and element styling

In this module, students dive into the world of JavaScript and learn its fundamentals, such as variables, operators, functions, and objects. They also learn about dynamically changing web page content using JavaScript and interacting with users

In this module, students get acquainted with server-side programming and working with databases. They learn a server-side programming language like Node.js and study the basics of working with databases, such as SQL

In this module, students practice developing a complete web application. They learn about the process of development, testing, and deploying web applications, as well as best practices and tools for improving the development process
Basic concepts and principles of photography, history of photography, types of cameras and their features
Adjusting camera settings (aperture, shutter speed, ISO), lens selection, use of different shooting modes
Rule of thirds, golden ratio, balance and harmony, selecting a perspective and shooting point
Using natural and artificial lighting, exposure measurement, exposure correction
Key techniques for capturing portraits, choosing location and background, using light to create mood
Characteristics of shooting natural landscapes, composition and perspective selection, working with lighting and colors
Capturing everyday life on city streets, capturing moments, working with people and the dynamics of the urban environment
Techniques for capturing dynamic scenes, using high shutter speeds, synchronizing with moving objects
